Job Description

The Data Scientist will provide decision science leadership to Sales and Marketing in the form of insights, key metrics and predictions drawn from data analysis. Maintain a passion for implementing new techniques to extract insights buried in data and working with colleagues to drive productivity improvements.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of marketing techniques and business strategies
  • Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes
  • Maintain current predictive models using the following machine learning methods: Logistic Group Lasso, Elastic Network Regression, AIC Stepwise Regression, Random Forest, Neural Network, Support Vector Machine, Gradient Boosting Tree, Partial Least Square Regression
  • Develop new modeling techniques for pattern recognition, prediction, classification, and other complex data science problems in marketing
  • Marketing programs analysis under the observational scenario
  • Share lead responsibility for building cloud-based analytical data pipeline
  • Automate models and dashboards that track business performance

    (1) Identify key leading indicators in conjunction with colleagues

    (2) Develop and implement business facing dashboards (Power BI, Shiny)
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • Document methodologies and increase institutional knowledge based on experimental results and operationalized solutions
Job Qualifications
  • Ph.D in Statistics, Data Science or Applied Mathematics highly preferred
  • 5+ years of experience applying predictive and analytic methods within a Sales and Marketing environment
  • Expertise in Bayesian statistics
  • Experience with modern methods for parallelized processing of large, distributed datasets (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, Map-reduce)
  • Experience working with web data (corpus of HTML documents, browse clickstreams, server logs)
  • Social media network and sentiment analysis
  • Knowledge of basic digital marketing, SEO and NLP
  • Lifetime learner philosophy – ability to identify and implement new methodology
  • Proficiency with a broad suite of machine learning techniques and expert ability to select the right technique
  • Very strong data mining and transformation skills
  • Ability to deal with data imperfections such as missing values, multi-collinearity, outliers and non-normal distributions
  • Proficiency with a major programming language appropriate for data science (e.g.; R, Python or Java) to manipulate data and draw insights
  • Proficiency with data visualization and dashboard tools
  • Strong ability to communicate insights in both technical and non-technical way
  • Ability to develop a broad technical network while working independently in a business environment

About DowDuPont

DowDuPont (NYSE: DWDP) is a holding company comprised of The Dow Chemical Company and DuPont with the
intent to form strong, independent, publicly traded companies in agriculture, materials science and specialty
products sectors that will lead their respective industries through productive, science-based innovation to meet the
needs of customers and help solve global challenges. For more information, please visit us at www.dow-dupont.com.

The positions represented by this job posting are aligned to one of the three divisions, Agriculture, Materials
Science or Specialty Products, which are expected to separate from DowDuPont into stand-alone public companies.
Information on the division alignment will be provided during the recruitment process.
